meanings.definition: A hard, silvery-white metallic element used in alloys and as a coating.
meanings.sent1: The nickel in the alloy made it strong and shiny.
meanings.sent2: She found a nickel on the sidewalk.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel mistook the nickel for a nut.
meanings.sent4: His smile gleamed like polished nickel under the bright sun.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the hammer hitting the nickel was like music to his ears.

meanings.definition: A United States or Canadian coin worth five cents.
meanings.sent1: I used a nickel to buy a piece of candy.
meanings.sent2: The vending machine accepted only quarters and nickels.
meanings.sent3: The nickel rolled away, causing a chase around the room.
meanings.sent4: Her savings grew, one nickel at a time.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the nickel dropping into the piggy bank was satisfying.

meanings.definition: To plate or coat with nickel.
meanings.sent1: He decided to nickel-plate the antique watch for preservation.
meanings.sent2: The jeweler carefully nickel-coated the jewelry to prevent tarnishing.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous elf tried to nickel-plate the garden gnome as a prank.
meanings.sent4: She wanted to nickel-coat her bicycle to give it a shiny finish.
meanings.sent5: The artist skillfully nickel-plated the sculpture, enhancing its beauty.
